meanings.definition: A person or thing that chokes.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was a choker when he tried to eat too quickly.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler was a choker in the competition, unable to handle the pressure.
meanings.sent3: The toaster became a choker when it got clogged with crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was a choker on the highway, causing long delays.
meanings.sent5: The tight knot in the rope turned it into a choker, making it hard to untangle.

meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful choker with a pendant for the party.
meanings.sent2: The choker she wore accentuated her elegant neckline.
meanings.sent3: The choker felt like a fancy ribbon hugging her throat.
meanings.sent4: The choker sparkled under the lights, drawing attention to her collarbones.
meanings.sent5: The choker was a perfect accessory to complete her outfit.

meanings.definition: A device used to constrict the flow of fluid in a pipe.
meanings.sent1: The plumber used a choker to control the water flow in the pipe.
meanings.sent2: The choker prevented the water from leaking out of the pipe.
meanings.sent3: The choker looked like a tiny belt tightening around the pipe.
meanings.sent4: The choker regulated the water pressure, ensuring a steady flow.
meanings.sent5: The choker was essential for maintaining the pipe system.

meanings.definition: A person who fails to perform well under pressure.
meanings.sent1: He was known as a choker in the final moments of the game.
meanings.sent2: The singer became a choker on stage, forgetting the lyrics under stress.
meanings.sent3: The choker froze during the presentation, unable to speak.
meanings.sent4: The actor turned into a choker during the audition, stumbling over lines.
meanings.sent5: The student became a choker during the exam, blanking out on answers.
